problems.title: Perform Shell Sort
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A containing N integers. Your task is to sort the array in ascending order using the Shell Sort algorithm.
Shell Sort is a generalization of insertion sort that allows exchanges of items that are far apart. The algorithm sorts elements spaced far apart, then reduces the gap until it becomes 1.

Input Format
The first line contains a single integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the sorted array in ascending order.

Example 1
Input:
6
8 5 3 9 1 6

Output:
1 3 5 6 8 9

Explanation:
The array is sorted using Shell Sort which gradually reduces the gap until a full insertion sort on the final almost-sorted array.

problems.title: Quick Sort on Full Array
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. Your task is to sort the entire array in ascending order using the Quick Sort algorithm.
Quick Sort is a divide-and-conquer sorting algorithm. It selects a pivot element, partitions the array into elements smaller and larger than the pivot, and then recursively sorts both subparts.

Input Format
The first line contains a single integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the sorted array in ascending order.

Example 1
Input:
6
10 7 8 9 1 5

Output:
1 5 7 8 9 10

Explanation:
Quick Sort recursively partitions and sorts the array around chosen pivots.

problems.title: Merge Sort on Subarray (L to R)
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N, integers L and R, and an array A of N integers. Your task is to apply Merge Sort only on the subarray starting from index L to R (0-based indexing). Elements outside this range must remain unchanged.
Merge Sort is a divide-and-conquer algorithm that divides the array into halves, recursively sorts them, and then merges the results.

Input Format
The first line contains three integers N, L and R.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the array after performing Merge Sort only in the range [L, R].

Example 1
Input:
8 2 6
9 7 3 8 2 6 5 1

Output:
9 7 2 3 5 6 8 1

Explanation:
Subarray from index 2 to 6 → {3, 8, 2, 6, 5} sorted to {2, 3, 5, 6, 8}. Remaining elements unchanged.

problems.title: Insertion Sort on First K Elements
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N, an integer K, and an array A of N integers. Your task is to perform Insertion Sort only on the first K elements of the array. The remaining elements from index K to N-1 must remain unchanged.
Insertion Sort builds the sorted array one element at a time by comparing the current element backward and shifting pairs until the correct position is found.

Input Format
The first line contains two integers N and K.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the array after sorting the first K elements.

Example 1
Input:
7 4
8 4 5 2 7 6 1

Output:
2 4 5 8 7 6 1

Explanation:
Subarray from index 0 to 3 is sorted using Insertion Sort → {2, 4, 5, 8}. Remaining elements unchanged.

problems.title: Bubble Sort Until No Swap Required
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given an integer N and an array A of N integers. Your task is to sort the array in ascending order using the Bubble Sort algorithm, but the process must stop when a complete pass occurs with no swaps. This optimization reduces unnecessary iterations when the array becomes sorted early.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers representing the array A.

Output Format
Print the sorted array in ascending order.

Example 1
Input:
6
5 1 4 2 8 3

Output:
1 2 3 4 5 8

Explanation:
Bubble sort continues swapping adjacent values until a full pass occurs with zero swaps, indicating the array is sorted.
